page.title: 02BISHOP BURTON COLLEGE
page.content: {Bishop Burton County College of {Agriculture,}(created in 1958), offers courses in agriculture, horticulture, farm management, business studies, machinery, pigs and horses, which are full-time or day-release. It has accommodation for 100 but total full-time students number 250, drawn from the U.K. and overseas. The new{Equestrian centre}was established in 1985. It caters for a full-time horse management course and YTS students. There are 11 horses and a staff of 4. A new undercover riding centre is being built. {The Rural Home {Economics}department offers both vocational and non-vocational courses, such as embroidery, fashion, flower arranging and cookery. The College also provides evening courses ranging from poultry-keeping and farm computing to woodwork and pottery!
